00036 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00037 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00038 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:

00041 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00042 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00043 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00044    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00045    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but uses a dedicated
00046    APIC-based timer interrupt instead, i.e. RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI). */
00047 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00048 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00049 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00050 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00054 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00055 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00056 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)

00058 struct xnthread;
00059 struct task_struct;
00060 
00061 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00062 
00063     /* Kernel mode side */
00064     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00065     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00066     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00067     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00068     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00069 
00070     /* User mode side */
00071     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00072     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00073 
00074     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00075     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00076     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00077 
00078 } xnarchtcb_t;
00079 
00080 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00081 
00082     unsigned vector;
00083     long errcode;
00084     struct pt_regs *regs;
00085 
00086 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00087 
00088 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)  ((fi)->vector)
00089 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)  ((fi)->errcode)
00090 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)    ((fi)->regs->eip)

00096 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00097 
00098 {
00099     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00100         return vmalloc(bytes);
00101 
00102     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00103 }
00104 
00105 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00106 
00107 {
00108     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00109         vfree(chunk);
00110     else
00111         kfree(chunk);
00112 }

00114 static inline int xnarch_shadow_p (xnarchtcb_t *tcb, struct task_struct *task)
00115 {
00116     return tcb->espp == &task->thread.esp; /* Sign of shadow... */
00117 }

00119 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00120 
00121 {
00122     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00123 }

00131 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00132                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00133     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00136 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00137 
00138 {
00139     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00140 
00141     adeos_load_cpuid();
00142 
00143     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00144        and always inside a critical section. */
00145     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00146     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00147     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00148     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00149     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00150 }
00151 
00152 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00153 {
00154     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00155 }
00156 
00157 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00158                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00159                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00160                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00161                                     )
00162 {
00163 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00164 
00165     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00166         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00167         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00168         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00169         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00170         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00171         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00172         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00173         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00174         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00175         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00176         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00177         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00178         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00179         "ret\n\t" \
00180 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00181         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00182         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00183       : /* no output */ \
00184       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00185         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00186         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00187         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00188         "b" (out_tcb), \
00189         "S" (in_tcb), \
00190         "a" (outproc), \
00191         "d" (inproc));
00192 
00193 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00194 
00195     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00196     
00197     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00198         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00199         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00200         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00201         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00202         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00203         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00204         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00205         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00206         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00207         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00208         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00209         "ret\n\t" \
00210 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00211       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00212         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00213         "=S" (esi_out), \
00214         "=D" (edi_out), \
00215         "+a" (outproc), \
00216         "+d" (inproc) \
00217       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00218         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00219         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00220         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00221 
00222 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00223 }
00224 
00225 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00226                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00227 {
00228     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00229     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00230 
00231     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)
00232         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00233            clear the ts bit. */
00234         clts();
00235     
00236     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00237 
00238     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00239         {
00240         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00241 
00242         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00243 
00244         if (!inproc->mm)
00245             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00246         }
00247 
00248     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00249 
00250     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00251 
00252         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00253            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00254            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00255            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00256            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00257            raw I/O ops. */
00258 
00259         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00260 
00261         barrier();
00262 
00263         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00264             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, adeos_processor_id());
00265 
00266             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00267                 
00268                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00269 
00270                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00271                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00272                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00273                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00274 
00275                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00276                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00277             }
00278         }
00279     }
00280 
00281     stts();
00282 }
00283 
00284 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00285                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00286 {
00287     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00288 }
00289 
00290 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00291 {
00292     /* Empty */
00293 }
00294 
00295 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00296                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00297                                          const char *name)
00298 {
00299     tcb->user_task = current;
00300     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00301     tcb->esp = 0;
00302     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00303     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00304     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00305 }
00306 
00307 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00308                                                int imask,
00309                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00310                                                void *cookie)
00311 {
00312     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00313     stts();
00314     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00315     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00316     entry(cookie);
00317     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00318 }
00319 
00320 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00321                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00322                                        void *cookie,
00323                                        int imask,
00324                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00325                                        char *name)
00326 {
00327     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00328 
00329     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00330     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00331     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00332     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00333     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00334     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00335     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00336     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00337     *--(*psp) = 0;
00338 }
00339 
00340 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00341 
00342 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00343 
00344 {
00345     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00346        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00347 
00348     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00349 
00350     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00351         {
00352         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00353         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00354         }
00355 }
00356 
00357 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00358 
00359 {
00360     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00361     
00362     if(task)
00363         {
00364         if(!(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00365             return;
00366 
00367         /* Tell Linux that we already saved the state of the FPU hardware
00368            of this task. */
00369         task->thread_info->status &= ~TS_USEDFPU;
00370         }
00371 
00372     clts();
00373     
00374     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00375         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00376     else
00377         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00378 }
00379 
00380 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00381 
00382 {
00383     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00384 
00385     if (task)
00386         {
00387 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 11)
00388         if (!tsk_used_math(task))
00389 #else
00390         if (!task->used_math)
00391 #endif
00392             {
00393             stts();
00394             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00395             }
00396 
00397         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00398            hardware. */
00399         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00400         }
00401 
00402     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00403        user-space or kernel thread. */
00404     clts();
00405 
00406     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00407         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00408     else
00409         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00410 }
00411 
00412 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00413 
00414 {
00415     clts();
00416 
00417     if(!cpu_has_fxsr && tcb->user_task)
00418     /* fnsave also initializes the FPU state, so that on cpus prior to PII
00419        (i.e. without fxsr), we need to restore the saved state. */
00420         xnarch_restore_fpu(tcb);
00421 }
00422 
00423 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00424 
00425 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00426 
00427 {}
00428 
00429 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00430 
00431 {}
00432 
00433 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00434 
00435 {}
00436 
00437 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00438 
00439 {}
00440 
00441 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */

00445 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00446 
00447     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00448 }
00449 
00450 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00451 
00452 {
00453     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00454                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00455                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00456                                      NULL,
00457                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00458 }
00459 
00460 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00461 
00462 {
00463     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00464                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00465                                      NULL,
00466                                      NULL,
00467                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00468 }
00469 
00470 static struct linux_semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00471 
00472 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00473 {
00474     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00475 }
00476 
00477 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00478     
00479 {
00480     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00481     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00482     unsigned long flags;
00483     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00484 
00485     sema_init(&xnarch_finalize_sync,0);
00486 
00487     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00488        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00489        context. */
00490     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00491                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00492 
00493     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00494     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00495     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00496     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00497 
00498     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00499         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00500     
00501     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00502                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00503 }
00504 
00505 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00506 
00507 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00508 
00509     return 0;
00510 }
00511 
00512 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00513 
00514     return 0;
00515 }
00516 
00517 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00518 
00519     return 0;
00520 }
00521 
00522 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00523 
00524 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00525 
00526 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00527 
00528 {
00529 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00530     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00531        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00532     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00533 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00534 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00535     xnshadow_release_events();
00536 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00537     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00538     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00539     schedule_timeout(50);
00540     xnarch_release_ipi();
00541 }
00542 
00543 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00544 
00545 {
00546     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00547 
00548     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00549         {
00550         spl_t s;
00551         splsync(s);
00552         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00553         splexit(s);
00554         return 1;
00555         }
00556 
00557     return 0;
00558 }
00559 
00560 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00561 
00562 {
00563 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00564     xnshadow_grab_events();
00565 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00566 }

00568 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00570 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00571 
00572 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00573 {
00574     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00575     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00576     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00577     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00578     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00579     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00580 }
00581 
00582 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00583 
00584 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00585 
00586 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00587                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00588                                            const char *name)
00589 {
00590     struct task_struct *task = current;
00591 
00592     tcb->user_task = task;
00593     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00594     tcb->esp = 0;
00595     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00596     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00597     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00598 }
00599 
00600 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00601 
00602 {
00603     unsigned irq;
00604 
00605     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00606         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00607                              handler,
00608                              NULL,
00609                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00610 }
00611 
00612 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00613 
00614 {
00615     unsigned irq;
00616 
00617     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00618         {
00619         switch (irq)
00620             {
00621 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00622             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00623             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00624             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00625             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00626 
00627                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00628                 continue;
00629 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00630 
00631             default:
00632 
00633                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00634             }
00635         }
00636 }
00637 
00638 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00639 
00640 {
00641     unsigned irq;
00642 
00643     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00644         {
00645         switch (irq)
00646             {
00647 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00648             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00649             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00650             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00651             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00652 
00653                 continue;
00654 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00655 
00656             default:
00657 
00658                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00659             }
00660         }
00661 }
00662 
00663 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00664 
00665 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00666 
00667 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00668     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00669        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00670        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00671        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00672     rthal_timer_program_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00673 }
00674 
00675 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00676     rthal_timer_release();
00677 }
00678 
00679 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00680 
00681 {
00682 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00683     return adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00684 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00685     return 0;
00686 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00687 }
00688 
00689 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00690                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00691                                         unsigned long long defval)
00692 {
00693 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00694     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00695     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00696     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00697 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00698     *shot = defval;
00699     *delivery = defval;
00700 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00701 }
00702 
00703 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00704 
00705 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00706 
00707 #include <linux/init.h>
00708 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00709 
00710 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00711 
00712 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00713 
00714 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00715 
00716 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00717 
00718 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00719 
00720 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00721 
00722 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00723 {
00724     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00725 
00726     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00727     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00728     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00729 
00730     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00731 }
00732 
00733 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00734 
00735 {
00736 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00737     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00738 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00739     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00740        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00741        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00742        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00743        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00744        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00745     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00746 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00747 }
00748 
00749 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00750 
00751 {
00752     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00753 
00754     if (!nktimerlat)
00755         return -ENODEV;
00756 
00757     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00758 
00759     return 0;
00760 }
00761 
00762 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00763 
00764 {
00765     int err;
00766 
00767 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00768     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00769        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00770     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00771 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00772 
00773     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00774 
00775     if (err)
00776         return err;
00777 
00778     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00779 
00780     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00781         return -ENOSYS;
00782 
00783     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00784                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00785                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00786                               NULL,
00787                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00788 
00789     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00790 
00791 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00792     err = xnshadow_mount();
00793 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00794 
00795     if (err)
00796         {
00797         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00798         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00799         }
00800 
00801     return err;
00802 }
00803 
00804 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00805 
00806 {
00807 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00808     xnshadow_cleanup();
00809 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00810     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00811     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00812 }
00813 
00814 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00815 
00816 #ifdef __cplusplus
00817 }
00818 #endif
00819 
00820 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00821 
00822 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00823 
00824 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00825 
00826 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_I386_SYSTEM_H */
